dataset.title: Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh Living Plant Collections (E)

abstract.para: The Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh was established in 1670 and during the 20th century acquired three Regional Gardens – the mountainous Benmore in Argyll; Dawyck in the wooded hills of the Scottish Borders and Logan on the Gulf Stream-warmed southern peninsula of Dumfries & Galloway. Together they represent one of the world’s largest living collections of plants.

intellectualRights.para: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Non Commercial (CC-BY-NC) 4.0 License.

gbif.citation: Rob Cubey (2018). Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh Living Plant Collections (E). Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/bkzv1l accessed via GBIF.org on 2021-04-22.
